node.title: South Korea will hospitalize all Covid patients taking the college entrance exam.
node.description: The decision comes as the country experiences rising caseloads again. The nine-hour test is seen as critical in determining students’ futures, and many have prepared for it since kindergarten.

node.title: Ew, David, Your Book Is a Best Seller!
node.description: What went on behind the scenes on “Schitt’s Creek”? Now readers can find out.

node.title: Ancient History Shows How We Can Create a More Equal World
node.description: New research on humanity's deep past holds lessons for the future.

node.title: Democrats, It’s Time to Get Moving
node.description: Pass something, and mandate vaccinations.

node.title: Facebook Faces New Antitrust Lawsuit
node.description: The suit, filed by the now defunct photo start-up Phhhoto, accused the social network of stalling on a deal and then putting it out of business.

node.title: 'Baby Shark' on Repeat Used as 'Torture Event' Against Oklahoma Inmates: Lawsuit
node.description: "It was unfortunate that I could not find a felony statute to fit this fact scenario," said Oklahoma District Attorney David Prater.

node.title: USS Connecticut Leaders Fired After Nuclear-Powered Submarine Hits Underwater Mountain
node.description: Vice Admiral Karl Thomas, commander of the U.S. 7th Fleet, said that the leadership team had been relieved "due to loss of confidence."

node.title: Federal Jail Secretary Charged With Smuggling Phones to Suspect in Rapper's Kidnapping
node.description: Three employees at a downtown Manhattan jail were charged with accepting bribes from prisoners in exchange for cellphones, booze and good reviews to a judge.

node.title: Doctors warn of melanoma time bomb amid drop in checks
node.description: A model has shared her frightening story of diagnosis, as doctors say they are fearful of a rise in patients being diagnosed with more advanced stages of melanoma.

node.title: Accused Cleo kidnapper had fake family on social media
node.description: The man charged with abducting four-year-old Cleo Smith is linked to a social media account that posts about loving children’s dolls and claims to have a partner and five children, despite living alone.

node.title: Friendlyjordies apologises to John Barilaro, settles defamation suit
node.description: As part of the settlement, comedian Jordan Shanks has issued an apology to John Barilaro for any offence caused by videos he posted on social media.

node.title: 'Like another world': Aurora australis seen over Tasmania was 'hands-down best' in years
node.description: Tasmanians were treated to a spectacular show from the aurora australis last night, with viewers describing it as "the best and strongest" they had seen in years.

node.title: NZDF to continue deployments to North Korea
node.description: The government has confirmed it will continue its deployments to North Korea, with defence force personnel to operate out of Kadena Air Base in Japan.

node.title: Environment groups criticise govt's decision to avoid methane cuts
node.description: Environmental groups say it is pointless and cynical for the government to sign up to a global pact to drastically slash methane emissions when it has no plans to match the goal itself.

node.title: Today's sports news: What you need to know
node.description: In today's sports news - De Groot staying with Highlanders, Tiatia confirmed as Moana Pasifika assistant coach and Ko on top in Middle East.

node.title: Transmission Gully opening stalls as quality signoffs await build completion
node.description: Only a quarter of the safety and quality assurance tests required under the contract to build Transmission Gully have been signed off on, as the opening date for the highway refuses to be pinned down.

node.title: 'We're not going back to that kind of level 1 life' - Covid-19 modeller
node.description: Reaching the 90 percent target could still mean spending about three quarters of next year in the 'Red' traffic light setting, but vaccinating children would help, Shaun Hendy says.

node.title: Civil rights group sues Tennessee over transgender sports ban
node.description: The suit calls the law unconstitutional and discriminatory against transgender children.

node.title: Climate change forces Native American tribes to relocate
node.description: The Quileute Tribe in western Washington has lost land before. This time, it's because of climate change.

node.title: Hong Kong will offer extra shots to high-risk residents next week.
node.description: By John Yoon

node.title: Ivy Nicholson, Model and Warhol Factory Star, Dies at 88
node.description: She blazed through 1950s Europe as a top fashion model and then became a part of the 1960s Warhol crowd in New York before falling on hard times.

node.title: Camille Saviola, ‘Deep Space Nine’ and Stage Actor, Dies at 71
node.description: She was known for her comic work in cabarets, for her performance in the musical “Nine” on Broadway and for her role in a “Star Trek” spinoff.

node.title: "I Have No Responsibility": Fauci Slams Rand Paul's Blaming of Him for COVID's Origin
node.description: "There were so many things that are egregious misrepresentation here," Fauci said of Paul's claims, "that I don't think I'd be able to refute all of them."

node.title: How the CDC Defines Being Immunized Versus Being Vaccinated
node.description: Though the agency notes the terms are often used interchangeably, there are slight differences between being "immunized" and being "vaccinated."

node.title: Gisborne flooding: More landslips likely after torrential rain - Civil Defence
node.description: Heavy rain has eased but the state of emergency remains in place in Tairāwhiti after two months' worth of rain fell in 36 hours, causing widespread flooding.

node.title: Yorkshire loses right to host internationals
node.description: Yorkshire County Cricket Club have been suspended from hosting international or major matches over their handling of allegations of racism by former player Azeem Rafiq.

node.title: California town wants federal help with lingering stench
node.description: One resident said the smell is so bad that they wear a face mask while inside of their own home.

node.title: NYC mayor-elect Adams: I'll take my first three paychecks in bitcoin
node.description: Days after winning his mayoral race, Adams vowed New York City will be "the center of the cryptocurrency industry."

node.title: Canada Turns Over Military Sexual Assault Cases to Civilian Courts
node.description: With the military’s leadership in crisis, a new defense minister adopted a recommendation to remove prosecutorial authority for sexual misconduct cases from the armed forces.

node.title: Is Meta’s Facial Recognition Retreat Another Head Fake?
node.description: If ever an issue cried out for some lawmaking guidance, this is it.

node.title: ‘North by Current’ Review: The Mornings After a Family Nightmare
node.description: In this documentary, the filmmaker Angelo Madsen Minax reckons with the loss of his niece, his vibrant sister’s rocky recoveries and being transgender in a traditional, Mormon environment.

node.title: Comedian Might Lose Radio Show After Calling Black Public Health Director a Racial Slur
node.description: "While we understand the importance of free speech, we recognize the difference between that and hate speech," said news director Lauren Schmitt.

node.title: NFL Has a Bizarre Week, and This Week's Games Are Only Just Beginning
node.description: From COVID to injuries, a trade whiff, a fatal car crash and more, this weekend's games couldn't get here fast enough.

node.title: Justice Department Sues Texas Over Voting Bill, Alleging It Violates Civil Rights Act
node.description: The DOJ stated that the law "restricts eligible voters' ability to cast a ballot and have that ballot counted."

node.title: What you need to know about the COVID lockdown rules in Katherine and Greater Darwin
node.description: Katherine has entered a three-day hard lockdown, and Greater Darwin has entered its first three-day lockout. Here's what you need to know.

node.title: Should Social Justice Be Part of Math Education?
node.description: Proposed guidelines in California would de-emphasize calculus, reject the idea that some children are naturally gifted and build a connection to social justice. Critics say math shouldn’t be political.

node.title: N.Y.C. reaches an agreement with nine labor unions on Covid vaccine mandates.
node.description: The unions represent about 88,000 of the 160,000 employees covered by the city’s latest mandate, which requires all city employees to get vaccinated or face unpaid leave.

node.title: Overlooked No More: Louise Blanchard Bethune, Who Changed the Face of Buffalo
node.description: She is widely considered to have been the first American woman to become a certified architect, and she left her stamp throughout western New York and in New England.

node.title: It’s Time to Change the Clocks Again. Why Do We Do This to Ourselves?
node.description: Most Americans don’t like this disruptive ritual — but they’re split about which side of the clock-switching system they prefer.

node.title: Immigrants Working for Lucrative Illegal Pot Farms Cheated Out of Pay, Fear for Their Lives
node.description: Many counties in Oregon are proposing measures to curb the number of illegal pot farms appearing across the state.
